title: Applied artificial intelligence technology for narrative generation based on analysis communication goals
abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) technology can be used in combination with composable communication goal statements to facilitate a user's ability to quickly structure story outlines using “analyze” communication goals in a manner usable by an NLG narrative generation system without any need for the user to directly author computer code. This AI technology permits NLG systems to determine the appropriate content for inclusion in a narrative story about a data set in a manner that will satisfy a desired analysis communication goal such that the narratives will express various ideas that are deemed relevant to a given analysis communication goal.
claims:
1. A method of applying artificial intelligence to generate a narrative story from structured data according to a narrative generation process, the structured data comprising a plurality of data values associated with a plurality of data parameters, the method comprising:
a processor processing a communication goal statement in coordination with (i) a set of narrative analytics associated with the communication goal statement and (ii) an ontology, wherein the ontology comprises a plurality of ontological objects that define a knowledge base about the structured data for the narrative generation process, wherein the ontological objects include a plurality of entities, and wherein the communication goal statement corresponds to a communication goal for analyzing a specified group of entities within the ontology;
wherein the processing step comprises:
parameterizing the associated set of narrative analytics based on a plurality of the data parameters, wherein the parameterized set of narrative analytics includes group size characterization analytics; and
executing the parameterized set of narrative analytics with respect to the structured data and the ontology, wherein the executing step includes (1) determining a size characteristic for the specified entity group based on the group size characterization analytics as applied to the structured data, and (2) selectively processing the structured data as a function of the determined size characteristic to determine at least one idea for inclusion in the narrative story; and
a processor generating a narrative story about the structured data based on the executing step, wherein the narrative story expresses the determined at least one idea in natural language and satisfies the communication goal corresponding to the communication goal statement.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein the ontological objects further comprise a plurality of attributes associated with the entities, and wherein the communication goal statement corresponds to a communication goal for analyzing the specified entity group by a specified attribute.

5. The method of claim 1 wherein the communication goal statement corresponds to a communication goal for analyzing the specified entity group by a specified characterization.
6. The method of claim 1 wherein the associated set of narrative analytics includes a parameterized conditional outcome framework.
7. wherein the executing step further includes a processor (1) determining which of the conditional outcome data structures is applicable to the structured data based on the conditions associated with the conditional outcome data structures, and (2) selecting an idea data structure that is linked with the determined conditional outcome data structure as the determined at least one idea; and
wherein the generating step includes a processor expressing the idea represented by the selected idea data structure in the narrative story.
